Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; exterior: frieze of geese walking to right (from left, part of neck, body and wing of first goose; at right, tip of tail of second goose); pendant triangle as filling ornament.
Producer name: Attributed to: Group of the Würzburg Chalices
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in the Würzburg Chalice Group. The sherds from this group display stylistic similarities to the two Würzburg chalices (Lemos 1991, pl. 20-1, no. 236-7).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 71, p. 235, no. 139)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0159) (phase 2)
